content: betsy s goose betsy s goose is a realistic looking canada goose with instructions also provided for a slightly rounder white goose made in one piece and knit in the round finished size is about 15 inches from tip of tail to bill and 5 inches wide materials required yarn app 150 yards total of worsted weight in brown black and white for canada goose or white and orange for white goose red heart super saver recommended size 4 double pointed needles darning needle stuffing 2 wooden match-sticks or other straight sticks to stabilize the legs scrap yarn to embroider eyes if desired abbreviations co cast on dpn double pointed needle k knit p purl m1 make one stitch see special note below st stitch sts stitches k2tog knit two stitches together pu pick up create a new stitch from existing work wt wrap and turn see special note below ssk slip next two stitches knit-wise place them back onto left needle and then knit them together through the back loop ~ 1 ~ special notes cid 1 the increases in this pattern m1 are made by lifting the right leg of the next stitch the right side of the stitch directly below the next stitch on your left needle placing it on the left needle then knitting it as you would any other stitch cid 1 the instructions regarding yarn color are for the canada goose white geese are worked entirely in white yarn with orange bills legs and feet the bodies of the two geese are worked the same except for the tail end instructions are given for both when you get to that point cid 1 the wrap & turn wt row are worked on dpns 1 and 3 only for the goose s breast and on all three dpns for his head after knitting the number of sts specified on the first needle bring yarn to the front of your work slip the next st on the left dpn to the right one move yarn to the back of your work and slip the stitch back to the left needle then turn your work and purl the stitches back to the beginning of the needle then purl the number of sts specified on needle 3 bring yarn to the back of your work slip the next st on the left dpn to the right one move yarn to the front of your work and slip the stitch back to the left needle then turn your work and knit the stitches back to the beginning of the needle there s a very good video on how to do knit wrap & turns or short row in the round at http //www youtube com/watch v=14ywbngfohm body with brown yarn co 36 sts onto 3 dpns 12 on each and work the following rounds 1-2 k all sts 3 m1 k6 repeat to end 4-5 k all sts 6 m1 k7 repeat to end 7-8 k all sts 9
